article_title: Hospital CEO Contends With Medicaid Conundrum
article_text:
KANSAS CITY, Mo.—The future of Truman Medical Centers, a two-hospital safety-net system here, depends on the state legislature—and no one understands that better than its new chief executive, Charlie Shields.

Mr. Shields, a genial 55-year-old, spent 20 years as a Republican lawmaker, ending up as the leader of the Missouri Senate before term limits forced him to step down. In 2010, he became chief operating officer of one of Truman’s...

twitter.description: The new chief executive of Truman Medical Centers in Kansas City, Mo., facing major losses, seeks a “Missouri-specific solution” to help his hospital system obtain more Medicaid dollars from the health law.
twitter.creator: @annawmathews

article_summary:
In 2010, he became chief operating officer of one of Truman’s...
KANSAS CITY, Mo.—The future of Truman Medical Centers, a two-hospital safety-net system here, depends on the state legislature—and no one understands that better than its new chief executive, Charlie Shields.
Mr. Shields, a genial 55-year-old, spent 20 years as a Republican lawmaker, ending up as the leader of the Missouri Senate before term limits forced him to step down.
